doc.after: The Beriev Be-200 Altair (Russian: ÐÐµÑÐ¸ÐµÐ² ÐÐµ-200) is a multipurpose amphibious aircraft designed by the Beriev Aircraft Company and manufactured by Irkut. Marketed as being designed for fire fighting, search and rescue, maritime patrol, cargo, and passenger transportation, it has a capacity of 12 tonnes (12,000 litres, 3,170 US gallons) of water, or up to 72 passengers.[1]
